page.title: 01WELCOME TO ALLENDALE
page.content: This straggling moorland haelth resort on the East Allen was once an important lead_mining centre;now it is a pleasant little town,its market_place and wide main street decorated with trees and shrubs and lined with substantial houses of grey stone.On a high and steep wooded bank above the river stands the Church of St.Cuthbert.An unusual feature on its walls is a sundial which bears a worn inscription indicating the town's latitude and longitude;this supports Allendale's claim to be exactly in the middle of Great Britain. A curious custom is still kept up here on New Year's Eve, when 24 quaintly_clad men march round the town with half barrels of blazing tar on their heads.At midnight a big bonfire is lit in the market_place,and the new year is welcomed in.
